title: Out of the studio and into the garden: John Humphrys talks weeds, no-dig and his love for Sir David Attenborough
text:
Many years ago John Humphrys was the guest chairman of BBC Radio 4 Gardeners’ Question Time and I happened to be on the panel. We recorded the show from the House of Commons and all twigged that he was mustard keen about growing things. Even without this insight, having woken up with the Today programme on Radio 4 for all 33 years that Humphrys has presented it, I was well aware that he was passionate about the ­environment – so when I heard the news of his retirement I emailed ­requesting an interview.

I got a typically humorous reply: “We’ll need LOTS of time because I intend to ruthlessly exploit your vast knowledge and ask you lots of questions about my sad garden now that I have the freedom...
